item.title: Why and How I Write
item.description: One of the things I’ve enjoyed in the TechWriters forum has been folks talking about their writing process. A few folks mentioned the Fieldstone writing technique by Weinsberg. I’ve enjoyed Weinsberg’s other books, like “Being a technical leader” and “Secrets of a consultant”, so I decided to give it a read. You can summarize the Fieldstone writing technique as: (1) collect related ideas in a file, (2) write stuff that energizes you, (3) switch projects to wherever you have the most energy.

item.title: An Ethical Profession: An Unsubtitled Sequel to Elegant Puzzle
item.description: When folks asks if I’ll write another book after An Elegant Puzzle, I sometimes joke that if I wrote another management book it would be An Ethical Profession, and I could refer to them as AEP1 and AEP2. There are just so many management situations that push you to look at them through an ethical perspective. A few of the situations that I’ve personally been in: Senior technical leader ordering you to pull a candidate’s offer after they’d already given notice at their previous job due to an awkward conversation.

item.title: About this site
item.description: I’m Will Larson, and I’ve been writing on my blog, Irrational Exuberance for over a decade, in addition to a couple longer form writing projects, Staff Engineer and An Elegant Puzzle. As more folks have started to read my work, I’ve been thinking about how to find a home for the sorts of content that I enjoy writing but which are too unedited and rough to share with readers who expect writing to be written for them as opposed for for me.
